abstract.p: Letter from Dr John Markowitz, associate professor of psychiatry at Cornell University, says psychotherapy and behavioral programs can help at-risk individuals develop the self-understanding to avoid contracting HIV (July 9 Scott Gottlieb Op-Ed article)

block.p: Re ''The Limits of the AIDS Miracle,'' by Scott Gottlieb (Op-Ed, July 9): Dr. Gottlieb is right; in AIDS, attitude is all important. This applies to the public as well as to doctors. Medications to treat H.I.V. have their limits. The key to curbing the epidemic remains prevention, which in turn requires appropriate attitudes toward high-risk behaviors. Psychotherapy and behavioral programs can help at-risk individuals to develop self-understanding and avoid contracting H.I.V.
JOHN MARKOWITZ, M.D. New York, July 9, 2000
The writer is an associate professor of psychiatry at Cornell University.
